> 
> 2. # add junit.jar to the CLA=
SSPATH. For example: set 
> classpath=3D%classpath%;INSTALL_DIR\junit3\juni=
t.jar
> ... Konsole window (KDE desktop)

Those look like windoze instructi=
ons, on linux you will not need the set
unless you are in some very strange=
 shell,  and the path separator is ':'
not ';' (which terminates a command)=
, and and the '\'s need to change into
'/'s. Also, on linux, it's CLASSPATH=
. So it should be:
CLASSPATH=3D$CLASSPATH:INSTALL_DIR/junit3/junit.jar
> 
>=
 # set classpath=3D%classpath%;home\user-admin\Junit\junit3.8.1\junit.jar
>=
 
 again, try: CLASSPATH=3D$CLASSPATH:home/user-admin/Junit/junit3.8.1/juni=
t.jar

thanks
